results.title: Escape from the sea
results.creator_credit: A. Frank Bundy, Wallace Productions and Peter Seabourne
results.brief_description: A film designed for a youthful audience depicting the adventures of a boy about 12 years old who gets into difficulty in the sea in his rubber dingy. He is rescued by a scouting group who then have problems when their leader is hit by falling rocks. He in turn is rescued by helicopter. Filmed on the foreshores of Cornwall this is a “safety” film showing the work of the Royal Naval Rescue Service and HM Coastguard.

results.title: Escape from sanity: a study of schizophrenia
results.brief_description: A detailed investigation of schizophrenia, the most common form of mental illness, interviewing patients and staff of a psychiatric hospital. Considers the causes of the condition and approaches to treatment and stresses the modern approach - the confrontation situation - based on research in schizophrenics’ families.

results.creator_credit: Stanley Croner, H William Varney and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Uses laboratory demonstrations and natural photography to investigate the processes of weathering, erosion and deposition of rock materials. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Erosion
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of Agriculture and Soil Conservation Service
results.brief_description: This film relates the story of man-made erosion, showing what it has done to the earth’s productive lands. Sheet and gully erosion by water and sheet erosion by wind and their destructive effects are graphically illustrated. Conservation farming methods can overcome both man-made and natural erosion.

results.title: Ergonomics: the practical approach
results.brief_description: Ergonomics is the study of the relationship between people, the equipment they use, and the physical environment in which they work. Ergonomics is a continuous process which aims to improve productivity and health through practical measures which reduce difficult situations. This program and guide looks at how ergonomics is applied, static and dynamic muscular effort, visual controls and displays, as well as a follow up questionnaire.
